document.title: California Common Core State Standards: English Language Arts and Literacy

28DBA71F5F9E40C787BC67BB207EC3A9.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

01232AB66A394CD58C95D1F4CF2A536A.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

0BB98940AE4B45BE8075201B145F22C3.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

6D49BCC65AF64EE59C54CC25EA3BB2D2.description: Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

0CE98F45AFCF4542B88A5CD9B9707863.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

C0CE3AE52E9A43E4B5934F195565FFFC.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases and to identify alternate word choices in all content areas.

6C45699BCBFF4D26BC138706AD0A6236.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

32DA0063D9CF4779B3A48FBA36071471.description: Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

3E793DE2ACFB48F0BA43D28D470AC6B1.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

805A7FD47C9045789F1A95671BDDAA74.description: Compare and contrast the varieties of English (e.g., dialects, registers) used in stories, dramas, or poems.

0CC68813DAD9484E984E140684BE4118.description: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

54B19FA66A9041F585BD9F2AD8B5AA68.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

79F11A17FCFF47F2A714047202B666E7.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

C8F156DD3A6B403D87928244FEC0AE82.description: Use underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works.

79F31A63B72141ED87EC7BB97ACEBED1.description: Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It's true, isn't it?), and to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that you, Steve?).

98D60BC85CA544C99380D0D9FD97FF22.description: Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the rest of the sentence.

47E96DD6C6A249F5B6FC781494E09082.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.

76294324FE874F889B2085370C27528A.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

756D8F66482F49A4A8DFFA3CB8599084.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.

C5DBF52056054EA380DB7AF008B1449C.description: Use verb tense to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.

8D2657436C864D4AB7A8EC8BD608FB3D.description: Form and use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked; I will have walked) verb tenses.

079439AB5EE74E819105245FE34B04A3.description: Explain the function of conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections in general and their function in particular sentences.

B0997A4C9A644B3D8A28F8262081644B.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

D0FB1545D7E34127953B3451C9601127.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

31F5DB7F29CA482E9E693525A78A3D29.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

516C0CD679DC417DAAF8242AF265F511.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

77C059C266B34BE78513E68139BB899B.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

C3E2133F995241E5A10E5117B3ED5C97.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

A4FC76D28FF74A8DAF4E6FBFD587F465.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

2A1B4C60E6FB40B7BED2AC0E6D6EBBD1.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

E9BBE3E2B2D947DE9924164EFE449C63.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate to task and situation.

F91A1F9CF221423AA0F729B8E4E5E132.description: Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

76979DC8A27C40A8ADBE8AC8BF266040.description: Memorize and recite a poem or section of a speech or historical document using rate, expression, and gestures appropriate to the selection.

C4F9C58A0A6D457C99D69E2C265C8AE6.description: Plan and deliver an opinion speech that: states an opinion, logically sequences evidence to support the speaker's position, uses transition words to effectively link opinions and evidence (e.g., consequently and therefore), and provides a concluding statement related to the speaker's position.

2FEB1311CEC64A4591CF8AA399F4FC83.description: Report on a topic or text or present an opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

0634D82D56B04B8BA20680EBDE3B1212.description: Summarize the points a speaker or media source makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and evidence, and identify and analyze any logical fallacies.

4142FA5748CF4F79B0ABE5F43DBB36C9.description: Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

08A4CD7306174DDDB07F55FD019C2D1D.description: Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in light of information and knowledge gained from the discussions.

49F37831E4CA49D6944BC3F7D84D7B28.description: Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the discussion and elaborate on the remarks of others.

E681CD3DE21A40E89E03FD219DED1CCC.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

003021209A9B4D6DAC6F42F79A4EF924.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

94BFB5114CA84423B6FF780F9060A263.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

CBB201D5725541C1854586B8B755B8F5.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

FE9A4F3910EB4C16A6758AB75D59CEBC.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

644C2FAD13984BA0862B5243081D5E4F.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

EDAE5771CE074C08B45BBE79B687C1EE.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

F1FCD50C3FFA45E1946AED438FA6C6B7.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

26659CC28F164CD6B430503EDA4B1472.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

C457AE634F084A0CBEC7BD2A07028E92.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

C79002E0EF9845398FA52F9BF1D6F503.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

F6DC843747AC4C3A9E3A2420E948CF39.description: Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., "Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point[s]").

77B1F30861B546D6A3C75A51157EFF16.description: Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., how characters interact]").

055E41D5F2C94DEB8E84790A9028A3FD.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

11ECDE6FAFE44C3AA0746A0C1D7AFE99.description: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; summarize or paraphrase information in notes and finished work, and provide a list of sources.

64ED08F33B9745A9944FAF8B4C9F8651.description: Conduct short research projects that use several sources to build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.

DBDA4C79ACA24A9E9EEF133A99DAE908.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

B53019D15DDB4657A59F07786BCC62A7.description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages in a single sitting.

4658D5A3035F49FE8E9C62ABBC596DBA.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

D931A12A00344E87B9EB8BC7DFF7014C.description: Produce clear and coherent writing (including multiple paragraph texts) in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
comments: (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1â€”3 above.)

0C4BCAF0BE4F4CC18368B8D18D3BDBEE.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

A3B947EC5D2240AFB4F3CB8EDE6A0EB1.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

D5817A4B8E244C34A33C4ED03CEE99FF.description: Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events.

CF56479BD88D4548A15C9180A8381C13.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

11F7D6C8537A4469AEB45EF78DFA5567.description: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

99E29AD1187C4435A02FA76ED5C9EFD5.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

F125C4BD1BF24479A56F7CCED58CD63E.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented

546462444DA94547A1A023AAD0EF4674.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

1282131B07DE4D3895C7F46D65445D24.description: Link ideas within and across categories of information using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., in contrast, especially).

1E7A51493B8C4E5AB77C9A46B057B3EB.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

FB07605075B04C79B27A74816E8A8B06.description: Introduce a topic clearly, provide a general observation and focus, and group related information logically; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

8EBB882B6DB2490988D7BAD013DBB923.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

BA9D7B6CFE7D4492AAEA6BECB5AABD7A.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

1353C404745E47AC9F9465DEB3F59CD8.description: Link opinion and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., consequently, specifically).

D0500C2B8CBE406DB5A145FBB9153CDA.description: Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by facts and details.

EC8C59EC2AAE4F4895A0023FE12ED401.description: Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer's purpose.

578F925EF551470CBD592ED6220C7969.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information

78D00594108447378BABE812354D0BA2.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

96399511252F4963A5BC29678BEA3D7F.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

AB12E0DA9D50442F84A6A1178B53CAC5.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

8CD6608E4B684353BE96091A1E8FB542.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

54B35DEF0D624181A41648ED67ECA3A0.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

586228FCEEFC43ADB0BD6AB00AF89627.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

1B2C4F9F7FDA4197BC84B6DECDEC7261.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

A809263C09FD482A87D78F5BC747CBF5.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

95145D9C472D4BFCA7D52CB4B6EB7617.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

E2C27C1A8C214BE68263944301F1A64C.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

863FE50B1AE44820BF1B1EAFC3E684BD.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

AD27C990C8314560BEFBAA5D3C3C6C3A.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

C5B14685F183410B92BFE7AF7E74105B.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

C366CB9D1A67411B82D1D00084C4EBBB.description: Read on-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings

3E15D27B3D4545C3A515907D0D9D7B6E.description: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

0EDB0840941E48C2AE3B2039CB0D983E.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

9B66EC026E374A19851387C0183451D9.description: Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context and out of context.

C24EE43BCAF147DA94F0C045B8A9BC02.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

42D44662EF90470F8E75C896C41BEA19.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 4â€”5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

39798995D44146DEA998532CA7372FCC.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A9FC7DDA80984212AB8B77AAED59F08C.description: Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

3DC7DC5A29F341ADA0799966E854938E.description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

ECFC0469741C4D0D872A8A3AC6E47E81.description: Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question quickly or to solve a problem efficiently.

F94EA1BE1FF747B6B58F81FEA942A154.description: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view they represent.

2DEF4960B7AC4CF08C1C18D94A36BB29.description: Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.

91989B06D5C046A6917CC2D2F3E76CBF.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area. (See grade 5 Language standards 4â€“6 for additional expectations.)

7A91DED47DA34C988B2AEFBDDEE35CA8.description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

AD383E3022A5407790C4BCE06E0112C5.description: Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details; summarize the text.

E4833E08548B4259A70915B37B95C8BF.description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

2A9BC64AAD214A4BB37C19B5D65267B8.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 4â€”5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

ADFB2CA1D4BF4AC28023C097D8D04CE6.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

2E4915A896824E668D080250786E75BD.description: Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.

E3AD1020EA2648F0A3B204DF6A1AAD3C.description: Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

33705233FBDA41B195A2AB00BD27AE0A.description: Describe how a narrator's or speaker's point of view influences how events are described.

E3DEA91E530C429C9345566B9561726E.description: Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

680556F72A2A4A8B82C5509977906EDD.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes. (See grade 5 Language standards 4â€“6 for additional expectations.)

33946CA26CD6459E8692992D0A0EDBCE.description: Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

A77B4AB39E584A589EB9CE736236EC73.description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize the text.

969ED897F00D4F039EE1DC9A601815F1.description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

E6D67A20BEB7494C8444E13F48BE84F8.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

957E7DBE03D24D0994BB3577DBB95249.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

27302361E9EC45A1AD65C07B780850C4.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

353C370FE62041D492269A0AC15D834E.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

85CA23A3F1E54815A76CA554A8E6869D.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.
comments: Please see "Research to Build and Present Knowledge" in Writing and "Comprehension and Collaboration" in Speaking and Listening for additional standards relevant to gathering, assessing, and applying information from print and digital sources.

74156018F7B54683A76AD5A4BE25E671.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

75CBC130578E49FB86451F2EB582A0A7.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

468419D92FE74494BF763C082D2DAF32.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

531141E2D5B54DF3B13245877969608C.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

842794EB851747B889C190C57A11A03B.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

A7B779D264404311AD9B36BE734C1D86.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

D6D0059521654C6C9E724FD99FC05886.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
